tn.ref: the things ... that Amos ... received in revelation
tn.text: Everything that God made Amos understand through what Amos saw or heard.

tn.ref: Yahweh will roar from Zion; he will raise his voice from Jerusalem.
tn.text: These two lines share similar meanings. Together they emphasize that Yahweh shouts loudly as he prepares to judge the nation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will roar
tn.text: like 1) a lion or 2) thunder (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh
tn.text: This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.

tn.ref: For three sins ... even for four
tn.text: "For many sins ... for too many sins" or "Because ... has sinned so much, has sinned more than I can permit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I will not turn away punishment
tn.text: "I will most certainly punish those people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: cut off the man
tn.text: Here "cut off" means either "destroy" or "drive away." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the man who holds the scepter in Beth Eden
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this to be the same man who lives in Biqat Aven.

tn.ref: the man who lives in Biqat Aven
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this to mean, "The people who live in Biqat Aven." The versions that have "the man" usually interpret this expression to mean the king.

tn.ref: Biqat Aven ... Beth Eden ... Kir
tn.text: names of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Eden
tn.text: different from the Garden of Eden

tn.ref: the man who holds the scepter
tn.text: the king or chief (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: For three sins ... even for four, I will not turn away punishment
tn.text: See how you translated these words in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:01:03|1:3]].

tn.text: Here "cut off" means either "destroy" or "drive away." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the man who lives in Ashdod
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this to mean, "The people who live in Ashdod." The versions that have "the man" usually interpret this expression to mean the king.

tn.ref: the man who holds the scepter from Ashkelon
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this to be the same man who lives in Ashdod.

tn.ref: I will turn my hand against Ekron
tn.text: or "I will fight against Ekron" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: For three sins ... even for four, I will not turn away punishment
tn.text: See how you translated these words in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:01:03|1:3]].

tn.ref: their covenant of brotherhood
tn.text: "the agreement they made to treat you as brothers"

tn.text: See how you translated these words in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:01:03|1:3]].

tn.text: "his wrath has lasted until now" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.text: "with many bad things happening all at once" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
